thread.title: How American soccer players in leagues abroad fared this weekend
thread.title_full: How American soccer players in leagues abroad fared this weekend

title: How American soccer players in leagues abroad fared this weekend
text:
How American soccer players in leagues abroad fared this weekend Resize Text By Steven Goff October 25 at 4:57 PM Follow @soccerinsider Tim Howard and Everton lost at Arsenal. (Reuters) 
A wrap-up of weekend performances by Americans playing in foreign leagues. 
Of note: Several players competing in lesser leagues or with reserve squads are not listed. Americans with dual nationalities representing other national teams have also been omitted. ENGLAND 
Everton goalkeeper Tim Howard: played 90 minutes in 2-1 defeat at Arsenal 
Aston Villa goalkeeper Brad Guzan: played 90 in 2-1 defeat to Swansea City 
Stoke City defender Geoff Cameron: played 9 minutes (thigh injury) in 2-0 defeat to Watford 
Sunderland defender DeAndre Yedlin, on loan from Tottenham Hotspur: played 90 at right back in 3-0 victory over Newcastle 
Tottenham Hotspur defender Cameron Carter-Vickers: played 90 in U21s’ 1-1 draw with Liverpool 
Sunderland midfielder Lynden Gooch: U21s vs. Manchester United on Monday Championship 
Fulham defender Tim Ream: played 90 minutes in 4-2 victory over Reading 
Reading midfielder Danny Williams: played 86 in 4-2 defeat at Fulham 
Birmingham City defender Jonathan Spector: played the first 45 in central midfield in 2-0 defeat at Hull City 
Nottingham Forest defender Eric Lichaj: played 90 at right back in 1-1 draw with Ipswich Town 
Blackburn Rovers defender Adam Henley: not in the 18 (red card suspension) in 1-0 defeat to Burnley 
Leeds United goalkeeper Charlie Horton: in the 18 but did not play in 1-1 draw at Bolton 
MK Dons goalkeeper Cody Cropper: not in the 18 (injured) for 3-0 defeat at QPR 
Fulham midfielder Emerson Hyndman: U21s at West Ham on Monday 
Reading forward Andrija Novakovich: U21s vs. Norwich City on Monday SCOTLAND Championship 
Rangers midfielder Gedion Zelalem, on loan from Arsenal: played 61 minutes in 1-0 victory at St. Mirren GERMANY Bundesliga 
Moenchengladbach midfielder Fabian Johnson: played 90 minutes in 3-1 victory over Schalke 
Werder Bremen forward Aron Johannsson: not in the 18 (adductor injury) for 3-1 victory at Mainz 
Hertha Berlin defender John Brooks: in the 18 but did not play in 1-0 victory at Ingolstadt 
Eintracht Frankfurt defender Timmy Chandler: entered in stoppage time in 2-1 victory at Hannover 
Ingolstadt midfielder Alfredo Morales: played 67 in 1-0 defeat to Hertha Berlin 
Bayern Munich forward Julian Green: played 90 (hat trick) in Bayern Munich II’s 4-1 victory over Augsburg II 
Borussia Dortmund forward Joseph Gyau: injury rehab for Dortmund II 
Borussia Dortmund midfielder Junior Flores: Dortmund II did not play this weekend 
Stuttgart forward Jerome Kiesewetter: played 77 in Stuttgart II’s 1-0 defeat at Aalen 
Moenchengladbach midfielder Mario Rodriguez: played 58 in Moenchengladbach II’s 1-1 draw at Cologne II 2 Bundesliga 
Union Berlin forward Bobby Wood: played 90 minutes in 2-0 defeat to Paderborn 
RB Leipzig forward Terrence Boyd: not in the 18 (knee injury) for 2-1 victory over Fortuna Duesseldorf 
Sandhausen forward Andrew Wooten: played 72 in 0-0 draw at Arminia Bielefeld 
FSV Frankfurt defender-midfielder Shawn Berry: played 90+ in 3-2 victory over Bochum 
Freiburg midfielder Caleb Stanko: in the 18 but did not play in 1-0 defeat at St. Pauli 
Freiburg goalkeeper Zack Steffen: played 90 in Freiburg II’s 1-0 defeat at Neckerelz FRANCE 
Nantes midfielder Alejandro Bedoya: not in the 18 for 2-0 victory at Caen 
Reims forward Jordan Siebatcheu: entered in the 58 th minute of 1-0 defeat to Monaco NETHERLANDS 
Utrecht forward Rubio Rubin: not in the 18 (ankle injury) for 2-1 victory at Zwolle 
Groningen defender Desevio Payne: not in the 18 (injured) for 1-1 draw at Nijmegen SWEDEN 
Helsingborg goalkeeper Matt Pyzdrowski: played 90 minutes in 2-1 defeat at Sundsvall DENMARK 
Viborg defender Babajide Ogunbiyi: not in the 18 (hernia surgery) for 4-2 victory over Esbjerg NORWAY 
Molde goalkeeper Ethan Horvath: played 90 minutes in 2-1 victory at Aalesund 
Molde forward Josh Gatt: not in the 18 (knee injury) for 2-1 victory at Aalesund 
Stabaek midfielder Cole Grossman: played 90 in 2-1 defeat at Viking 
Viking defender A.J. Soares: played 90 in 2-1 victory over Stabaek 
Bodo/Glimt defender Zarek Valentin: played 90 in 3-0 defeat to Lillestrom 
Bodo/Glimt midfielder Danny Cruz, on loan from Philadelphia Union: in the 18 but did not play in 3-0 defeat to Lillestrom 
Mjondalen defender Rhett Bernstein: in the 18 but did not play in 1-1 draw at Start 
Mjondalen forward Erik Hurtado, on loan from Vancouver Whitecaps: played 77 in 1-1 draw at Start 
Start defender Alex De John: played 90 in 1-1 draw with Mjondalen MEXICO Liga MX 
Veracruz midfielder Joe Corona, on loan from Tijuana: entered in the 70 th minute of 3-2 victory over Toluca 
Club America defender Ventura Alvarado: not in the 18 for 1-0 defeat to Queretaro 
Queretaro defender Jonathan Bornstein: played 90 in 1-0 victory at Club America 
Tijuana defender Michael Orozco: not in the 18 for 3-1 defeat at Monterrey 
Tijuana forward Paul Arriola: not in the 18 for 3-1 defeat at Monterrey 
Tijuana midfielder Alejandro Guido: not in the 18 for 3-1 defeat at Monterrey 
Monterrey defender Edgar Castillo: played 90 in 3-1 victory over Tijuana 
Leon forward Miguel Ibarra: at Puebla later Sunday 
Leon goalkeeper William Yarbrough: at Puebla later Sunday 
Tigres midfielder Jose Torres: in the 18 but did not play in 0-0 draw at Dorados 
Atlas defender Greg Garza, on loan from Tijuana: hip surgery, out several months 
Chiapas defender Gabriel Farfan: not in the 18 for 3-2 victory at Pumas VENEZUELA Primera Division 
Metropolitanos goalkeeper Diego Restrepo: in the 18 but not starting at Tucanes later Sunday Steven Goff is The Post’s soccer writer. His beats include D.C. United, MLS and the international game, as well as local college basketball. sports Success! Check your inbox for details. You might also like: Please enter a valid email address Sign Up
